alert.note: Alert for Humphreys; Sharkey; Yazoo (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 7:31PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Yazoo, southwestern Humphreys and northeastern Sharkey Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 731 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Anguilla, or 9 miles east of Rolling Fork, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Yazoo, southwestern Humphreys and northeastern Sharkey Counties, including the following locations... Louise. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for central and west central Mississippi.
